title: Add support for Lucene's persian analysis
description:
In this case, only a factory for the PersianNormalizationFilter (LUCENE-1628) is needed.

But the stopwords are very important, many are not really words such as the plural ها
So, an example showing how to load these from the jar file (similar to SOLR-1336) should do the trick.

comments.author: Robert Muir
comments.content: factory for the filter, and schema.xml examples (maybe unnecessary, feel free to ignore)

comments.author: Robert Muir
comments.content: Hoss Man generated the factory for the filter and committed it in r812768 so I think we are good here.
